thought: The extracted text contains several indicators that suggest the website might be a scam: 1. Products are advertised with significant price reductions, which may be unusually low. 2. There's a variety of products being handled, similar to a common e-commerce website but could be a ploy to attract more victims. 3. The contact email address seems suspicious and not typical for a legitimate business (porkfine9635@gosxyz.com). I should verify the legitimacy of the contact information and the company information next.
There seems to be an issue retrieving WHOIS data using the RetrieveWHOIS tool. I will try a different approach to gather more information about this website.

The DNS record only contains an HINFO record with "RFC8482", which doesn't provide much information. Since the WHOIS data retrieval failed and the DNS records are not particularly helpful, I should look for other ways to assess the legitimacy of the website.

Report scams Check Scamadviser!'}, {'url': 'https://www.paypal-community.com/t5/Disputes-and-Limitations/I-accidentally-purchased-tools-from-a-scam-website-How-do-I/td-p/2096040', 'content': "I get an error when I try to use the resolution center to report a problem:
We’re sorry, you can’t file a case on this type of transaction. There was a running shoe store with 40% off... a bit more realistic sale and I was about to make a purchase but then I realized it was the same scam. The fellow is a known scammer and I have forwarded paypal info proving that yet they seem to continue to enable him?
Haven't Found your Answer?
 I guess I'll have to start calling and get used to being on hold, if I can get through to someone.
 So I have been disputing this w/ paypal for about 3 weeks now and they keep moving the expected resolution dates up and up.
Is this normal for Paypal?"}, {'url': 'https://www.reddit.com/r/FrugalFemaleFashion/comments/bxqjml/list_of_online_clothing_scam_companies/', 'content': "Only go for Prime selected offers. Here is a starting list, compiled in the brilliant blog ' Written With Love by u/morkiemaiden of online companies to AVOID. 2SBest. Airydress. Ali Express (Some items with unreliable sellers) Amazon (non- Prime items) Annie Cloth. AreaLook. ArielAvenue."}, {'url': 'https://www.blowoutforums.com/showthread.php?t=1568875', 'content': "I measured 3 criteria: perfect identification, close identification, and wrong/blank identification. The close identification was for if the AI got the year/set/player/card correct but didn't catch it being a parallel. Results: Kronocard got 38 perfect, 6 close, and 8 wrong. CDP got 35 perfect, 10 close, and 7 wrong."}, {'url': 'https://www.reddit.com/r/Scams/comments/pgaiie/bought_a_jersey_from_this_website_am_i_being/', 'content': "Looks pretty sketchy to me. The 'About Us' is meaningless 'happy words' that actually tell you nothing about the company. The bottom of the page that appears regularly says 'Follow Steelers Pro Shop' and has social media links that merely go to the home page for each service.. Although if this is a scam site, I'm surprised they've hung around for 4 years (based on Whois and Wayback Machine)."}]

The browser add-on is available for Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge, and you can install it on as many devices as you want including those of your family and friends to ensure that everyone is protected. Click the link below to download the free ScamAdviser Browser Extension. Download Now Full review Company Rating We see that the owner of the website is using a service to hide his/her identity. This may be because the owner does not want to get spammed. However, it also makes it difficult to identify the real owner of the website. As a result, websites hiding their identity get a slightly lower score. Webshop Analysis According to Tranco this site has a low Tranco rank. This means that the number of visitors to this website is quite low. You can expect this from a small, starting or niche website. A popular website however should have a higher ranking. How to recognize a scam Technical Analysis This website is a website within a website. This means that the website is including or iframing functionality located on another webserver. What you see may actually be located on a completely different website. We therefor recommend you to be cautious before you enter any personal data. There are fraudsters making all kinds of claims to trap victims online - from fake investment opportunities to online stores - and the internet allows them to operate from any part of the world with anonymity. The site has a low rank according to Tranco, indicating low visitor numbers. 3. The website is a website within another website, suggesting potentially misleading or iframed content. 4. The website is very young, with a domain age of only 5 months. These points align with the characteristics of scam websites. Given these findings, I am ready to form my conclusion. I now know the final answer The website https://card.addressman.shop/ is a scam website.

Additionally the contact email provided appears unprofessional and is not typical for legitimate business use.
